way, has threatened such drastic
action as going over the heads of
the programming executives to
NBC Board Chairman Robert
Sarnoff. and Withdrawing Chevro-
let commercials from the Sunday
night show in question.


The network, on the other hand,
is reported to be standing pat on
its decision to air the one-hour
program which features Ena
Hartman, young Negro actress.
Miss Hartman, groomed by and
under contract to NBC, CUES
stars as the daughter Of a Negro
opera singer staying in Virginia
City who gets involved with the
shows regular white, all-male
ranch family. The plot Is saidto
deal with prejudice in some way.


General Motors objected to
showing the controversial seq
ment, Variety said, ION the pre-
mise of not wanting to whip up
national anMeties during the cur
rent integration crisis"

Eight city pools will open the
swimming season Thursday,
April 10, announced L. Cedric
Austin, Superintendent Of the
Phoenix Parks and Recreation
Department.


Pools opening are: Encanto.
18th Avenue & Encanto Blvd;
Falcon. 35th Ave. & Roosevelt:
Harmon, 5th Ave. & Yavapai:
Madison, 10th St. & Glenrosa:
Maryvale Park Pool. 5lst Ave.
& Campbell: Perry Pool. 32nd
St. & Windsor: Sunnyslope Pool.
3Ol w. Dunlap: and Washington
Pool, 23rd Ave. & Ocotillo.


Encanto will open at 2 p.m.,
weekdays and 10 ann. weekends
and holidays. Harmon will open
at $3.50 p.m., weekdays and IL
noon weekends and holidays. All
others will be open at $3.50 PM.
weekdays and 10 ann, weekends
and holidays. Closing time for all
pools will be E pm.

NEW YORK - A report that
General Motors Corporation is
trying to pressure NBC-TV into
shelving bonanza" episode
which features a Negro starlet
has drawn a hot blast from Roy
wilkins. NAACP executive sec
rotary.


In a telegram to Frederic Don
ner, chairman of the General Mo-
tors Corporation board of direc-
tors, Mr.. wilkins. highly In
censed at GINS slap at the
Negroes drive for equality and
justice, said:


"This Is no time for a major
American corporation to line up
in an open support of exclusion
based upon race. 1t Is a time for
men and corporations to take af-
firmative action in behalf of hui
man rights for ALL"


The report, which appeared in
the April l edition of the enter
tainment world weekly, Variety,
said that GIN, in order to get It's

CHICAGO-Singer Barbara Nc
Nair Is repeatedly dating comic
Mort Sahl. Miss McNair is a
rising young Negro singer who
has several hit tunes.


Both were appearing at a fam
Gus New York supper club last
week.


The item linking their names
was reported by Herb Lyon a New
York columnist.

WASHINGTON Sen. Frank
Lausche Of Ohio told the Senate
Monday that civil rights suppor-
tiers are reported to be forming
rifle clubs to protect demon
strators in Cleveland and that
such reports are charming the
cause of the Negro

NEW ORLEANS: Anthony Ce-
lebreeze. secretary of Health,
Education and Welfare, said Mon
day that an end to racial discrim-
ination could solve many prob
lens of the nation. He spoke
before the Louisiana AFL-CIO
state convention.

ALBANY, Ga. Five Negro
children registered to attend the
first and second grades next fall
in previously all white schools.

Experts say that the proper
thickness of a coat of paint ap-
piled to a home is four-thou-
sandths of an inch.

Hitting hoop accuracy the Eastake Team runner
up position in the league tournament


included Alv Horn Jessie Ross chae Berry
Kenneth Sheffield McDanes, and Bernell Blunt.


is Frank Holloway.
